runs.comm: good start, on off stump, defended to the off side
full outside off, tempting the drive and it scoots past the outside edge...movement under the lights
punched into the covers...valuable early dot-balls here
length ball, Smith goes for an expansive pull but doesn't make contact and the ball flies over the stumps
he's away this time, angled down to third man
expansive drive from Bosman first ball, skews off the outside edge and goes one bounce down to third man
short and loose to start, but Bosman tried to welly it, and missed out on a gift
much better line, tight and beats the edge
ugly but effective, Bosman was aiming over midwicket, ended up with a thick edge through third man. South Africa's first boundary
that's more effective. Bresnan strains for the outswinger but ends up  being wafted into the midwicket stands
pushed into the covers, better line to complement the full length
that's a nasty delivery, pace and bounce surprises Smith who wears the ball on his gloves without really leaving his stance. A mixed over
pushed tentatively into the covers. Anderson's full length is very probing
his not-so-full length, however, is there to be walloped! Fractionally too short, and swiped into the stands!
pushed onto the stumps and deflected down to third man
clipped into the leg-side
stand-and-deliver batting! A hint of width, and that is rifled through the covers with no footwork and a wonderful eye
striding down the pitch, and humped for four again. An expensive over, and South Africa are up and running
on his pads, and worked to square leg
too full and straight, and biffed over long-on. Bosman gives that one a free transfer
full and straight, better line and length
back of a length, climbs into the bat, good pace
slower-ball bouncer ... at least I think it was. Either way, Bosman doesn't pick that.
a shy at the stumps sends the off pole cartwheeling, just to emphasise that there's no run there
back and across from Smith, but he can't quite pull that one away
slower ball again, Smith is down the track, but he mistimes his swipe
another swipe across the line, this time there's enough bat to clear Swann at mid-on
bouncer, top-edged, six. Have some of that
strides out of his crease, and drills that superbly through the covers. A good over for Smith and South Africa
slower ball again, and Bosman gets right underneath that. Cook back-pedals frantically, but it was always getting away from him
short again, and pulled through midwicket
quicker ball, rising on leg stump, and Smith somehow drives that over square leg!
wrong line again, and from a slow start Smith has hurtled out of the blocks. Driven over mid-on, and the runs are leaking everywhere
slower ball again, short outside off, and Smith wellies it just short of Cook at mid-on
stunning. A short-arm jab over square leg, and Mahmood's figures have been butchered
great first delivery, full and straight, and an lbw appeal is stifled by an inside-edge
pushed down the ground, and that's an encouraging length from Wright. Full and fuller, basically
biffed down to the cover sweeper. Tidy work from Wright
a momentary error in length, and Bosman makes him pay again! Another swipe over midwicket, and the good work is undone
that's the response. A proper yorker, arguably the first of the innings
swished down the ground, and picked up at cover
floated onto a good length, and brutalised back over the bowler's head. That is a sweet strike!
a rare miscue, but it lands safe at mid-on
another six, but oh so nearly intercepted by a leaping Mahmood on the cow corner rope. Instead, it's yet another bludgeoned six
worked into space
dabbed to midwicket, and that's Bosman's fifty - from 26 balls, the second fastest by a South African, and one run faster than Collingwood's earlier in the match
yorker length, dug out. A rare dot ball
wide and wider. Well outside the tramlines
waist-high full-toss, and Bosman belts it through midwicket. Stunning striking this evening
it's boundaries and singles at the moment. This time it's the latter
that's what England desperately needed. Another slower ball, drilled out to deep point, where Eoin Morgan steadies himself and pouches a fast, flat chance
good start to the new batsman, targetting the top of off, and defended
worked down to third man with a flick of the wrists
smacked down to long-on from a good length, and that wicket has just cooled the ardour of this innings. Not for long, I'll wager
low full-toss, swatted over midwicket, and cut off in the deep

that has gone miles and miles in the air. Someone is going to be under it, and the skipper makes the call at midwicket. Steadies himself well, clings on and falls to the turf in his followthrough, and that is not only a vital wicket, it's the end of a brilliant innings
forward, and off the mark first-ball with a whip through midwicket
a hint of drama as de Villiers dives for his crease as the shy comes in, but he's well home
a fraction too wide, and dabbed sweetly through fine leg
swiped to midwicket, and there's no run there
on the pads, a wasteful half-volley delivery, and dinted over square leg
wrong line again, poor stuff so far this over
that is much, much better, and that is also out! Pitches just on leg stump, nips away, and raps the pad halfway up. Timely, and this could be a cracking finish
worked off the pads, down to fine leg, just the single
good line and length, and defended back down the track
tidy again, deflected into the gully, and poor communication denies the batsman a single
driven into the covers, Mahmood found his length in that over, and after a stuttering start it turned into a good one
worked off the pads, out to midwicket
dug out again, good full length, and pushed back to the bowler
probing stuff, Swann fields in his followthrough
nothing to work with yet in this over
spoke too soon, a low full-toss, and that is swatted into the stands
nurdled straight to midwicket, and it is getting properly damp now. We might have a problem
full length, tucked to midwicket, a quick single
great shot, better stop. Rubbish ball, mind you, but a certain four was intercepted by a diving Cook at point
carved into the deep, another single
slower-ball bouncer, and that's called wide, much to Anderson's chagrin
nips away off the seam, and evades the swipe
on the pads this time, and cut off at square leg
swished out to midwicket, and Anderson has clawed England into the D/L ascendancy. What drama
